thread.title: Sports news in brief, Oct. 7, 2015

author: The Associated Press
title: Sports news in brief, Oct. 7, 2015
text:
Previous Next Sports news in brief, Oct. 7, 2015 
LSU head coach Les Miles sings the LSU alma mater with his players after the Oct.3 game against Eastern Michigan in Baton Rouge, La. Because of damage from recent, devastating floods, South Carolina’s athletic director isn’t certain whether his school can host this Saturday’s game against LSU. Gerald Herbert/The Associated Press Sports news in brief, Oct. 7, 2015 
Minnesota Lynx center Sylvia Fowles (34) and Indiana Fever center Lynetta Kizer (12) battle for a rebound in the first half of Game 2 of the WNBA basketball finals Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, in Minneapolis. (AP Photo/Jim Mone) Sports news in brief, Oct. 7, 2015 
Lionel Messi Sports news in brief, Oct. 7, 2015 Associated Press | 0 comments 
Athletic director not 100 percent sure South Carolina will host LSU game 
COLUMBIA, S.C. — South Carolina athletic director Ray Tanner is not “100 percent sure” that Saturday’s football game against No. 7 LSU will be played at Williams-Brice Stadium because of the devastating floods that hit the state this past weekend.
